title: Guidelines issued for resuming public activities and work settings
author: adaderana
body: A set of instructions has been published for the resumption of selected public activities and work settings while preventing and controlling the spread of the COVID-19 virus.

title: CWC Leader Arumugam Thondaman passes away, age (56)
author: dailymirror
body: CWC Leader Arumugam Thondaman passes away, aged 56, Subsequently, he had reportedly died following a heart attack, Mortal remains currently at Thalangama Hospital

title: 96 COVID-19 cases increase to 1,278
author: dailymirror
body: The number of COVID-19 infected cases in Sri Lanka has increased to 1,278 today, the Health Ministry said. Among the latest cases reported today, 88 are arrivals from Kuwait.

title: Curfew in all districts relaxed from today
author: adaderana
body: The Government has announced that the curfew for all districts will be in force between 10.00 pm and 4.00 am daily, from today (26) onward. This curfew relaxation schedule will be operative until further notice.

author: dailyft
body: The long weekend saw a worrying development of 119 confirmed cases of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) in the country propelling the cumulative figure to 1,182 apart from recording the 10th fatality.
title: COVID-19 whammy over long weekend
Sri Lanka curfews relaxed amid progress in Coronavirus battle, foreign returnee dies
body: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is relaxing daytime Coronavirus curfews country-wide from May 26 though travel curbs to Colombo and Gampaha will remain amid strong progress made against the spread of the Covid-19 with officials advising the public to maintain distance.
author: economynext

title: 10th COVID-19 death in Sri Lanka
body: Director General of Health Services, Dr. Anil Jasinghe confirmed Sri Lanka’s 10th death due to COVID1-9 a short while ago.
author: newsfirst

title: Curfew in Colombo to be lifted after 2 months: Island-wide curfew from 10 pm to 4 am.
body: Colombo (News 1st): Sri Lanka will remove the curfew imposed in Capital Colombo starting from tomorrow after a two-month-long lockdown style curfew.
author: newsfirst

title: Sri Lanka Health Minister declares no more community spread of COVID 19
body: ECONOMYNEXT– Sri Lanka’ s Health Minister is declaring that for the past three weeks no COVID 19 positive cases have been reported from the general public and that indicates there is no more community transmission of the virus.
author: economynext

title: COVID-19 exposure notification settings begin to go live for iOS users with new update
body: Apple  has released iOS 13.5, which includes support for the Exposure Notification API that it co-created with Google to support public health authorities in their contact-tracing efforts to combat COVID-19. The API requires third-party apps developed by public health authorities for use, and none have yet been released, but iOS device users already have access to COVID-19 Exposure Logging global settings.
author: techcrunch

title: No Government funds for Homagama Cricket Stadium - SLC
body: The Homagama Cricket Stadium project will be an absolute and private investment of Sri Lanka Cricket and no government funds will be utilized and/or will be sought at any stage of the construction, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) said in a statement.
author: dailynews

title: Amphan Super Cyclone moves away from Sri Lanka to hit India & Bangladesh
body: SUPER STORM: An animation of the super cyclonic storm Amphan released by the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
author: economynext

title: Ratnapura affected the most by inclement weather; 2 deaths reported
body: Deaths of two individuals have been reported from the Ratnapura District owing to the prevailing inclement weather.According to the Police, a 9-year-old boy has died as a part of a house in the Batapola area of Wewelwatta had collapsed due to an earth slip.
author: adaderana

title: Flight carrying 300 Sri Lankans arrives from Kuwait
author: adaderana
body: A Kuwait Airways flight carrying 300 Sri Lankan nationals from Kuwait landed at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, a short while ago.

title: Trade deficit shrinks in Feb. as COVID-19 bites
author: dailyft
body: Sri Lanka’s trade deficit shrank to $ 574 million in February, significantly less than the January deficit of $ 730 million, on early signs of COVID-19 impact, latest Central Bank data showed, even though exports grew by 0.7% to $ 988 million when compared with a year ago.

title: 21 COVID-19 patients recovered, COVID-19 recovered cases rise to 559
author: dailynews
body: wenty-one persons who had tested positive for the virus had recovered from the virus by this morning, raising the total coronavirus recoveries to 559.

title: Fifteen more navy personnel recover from Covid-19
author: adaderana
body: Fifteen more navy personnel receiving treatment for Covid-19 have recovered and were discharged from hospital today, the Sri Lanka Navy said.

author: economynext
body: Sri Lanka’s hotels are ready to open for tourists in July if authorities give permission though health rules to contain the risk of Coronavirus is pushing up operating costs, an industry official said.
title: Sri Lanka tourist hotels ready to open in July, health rules drive costs up

author: newswire
body: Over 38,983 Overseas Sri Lankans (OSLs) in 143 countries at present seek to return home, based on information gathered mainly through the ‘Contact Sri Lanka’ Web Portal of the Ministry of Foreign Relations.
title: Covid19 : Over 38,000 Sri Lankans in 143 countries seek to return home

author: dailynews
body: As the Covid–19 Healthcare and Social Security Fund surpassed one billion rupees, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa promised to make the Fund’s audited reports public to ensure transparency.
title: Covid-19 Fund surpasses Rs one billion

author: adaderana
title: 189 Navy personnel recovered from COVID-19 so far
body: Twelve more Sri Lanka Navy personnel who had been receiving treatment for COVID-19 infection have been discharged from the hospitals following being tested negative in PCR tests. Seven among them had been receiving treatment at the Homagama Hospital, three at the Mulleriyawa Hospital, and two at the Infectious Diseases Hospital, stated Sri Lanka Navy.

author: adaderana
title: 23 among yesterday’s detections are Navymen – Army Chief
body: Twenty-three among the novel coronavirus detected yesterday (16) were identified among Sri Lanka personnel, stated Commander of the Army Lieutenant General Shavendra Silva. In total, 25 new cases of COVID - 19 infections were identified yesterday.

author: adaderana
title: 177 navy men recovered from COVID-19 so far
body: Another 26 naval personnel who were confirmed coronavirus-positive have made complete recoveries, Sri Lanka Navy said in a statement issued today (16). These navy men had been undergoing treatment at the Naval General Hospital(20), Homagama Hosptial(01) and Mulleriyawa Hospital(05). These discharged navy men will be kept under quarantine for another 14 days in compliance with the healthcare instructions.

author: dailynews
title: Island-wide curfew from today 8pm
body: Campaigners call for fashion brands to protect workers in their supply chains globally as coronavirus causes orders to dry up

author: adaderana
title: 43 new COVID-19 recoveries take total count to 520
body: orty-three more patients who had tested positive for COVID-19 virus in Sri Lanka have returned to health, the Ministry of Health said today (16). Sri Lanka’ s coronavirus recoveries tally thereby reached 520. New recoveries are reported from Infectious Disease Hospital(IDH), Welikanda Base Hospital,Colombo East Base Hospital,Navy Hospital and Homagama Base Hospital.

author: newsfirst
title: WHO warns of a multisystem inflammatory condition in children. Calls on health authorities worldwide to be on alert
body: The World Health Organization last evening called on health authorities worldwide to be on alert for a multisystem inflammatory condition in children, that has been reported from Europe and North America.

author: newsfirst
title: Foreign investors return to Sri Lankan bonds after 4-months
body: COLOMBO (News 1st): Foreign investors returned to Sri Lanka government securities this week, the first time in four months, government data showed.

author: newsfirst
title: Sri Lanka’s COVID-19 cases rises to 949
body: COLOMBO (News1st): Sri Lanka’s number of coronavirus patients rose to 949 after 14 people tested positive for the virus on Saturday, the health ministry said.One patient had returned from Chennai in India recently,director general of health services Dr.Anil Jasinghe said in a statement.

author: adaderana
title: Sri Lanka tea prices soar despite COVID-19 disruptions
body: Sri Lanka’ s tea prices at Colombo tea auction rose sharply during 2020 Q1, whilst Sri Lanka’ s tea production declined by nearly 30 % Q / Q for the same period,according to a report released by ICRA Sri Lanka, a subsidiary of Moody’ s Investor Services.The rise in tea prices was largely attributable to the global supply shock from unfavorable weather conditions in most black tea exporting nations,it said.

author: aljazeera
title: Sri Lanka: Muslims face extra threat as coronavirus stirs hate
body: Sri Lanka makes cremations compulsory for COVID-19 victims, but Muslims and activists urge authorities to allow burials.

author: yahoo
title: Sri Lanka faces cash crunch without parliament amid virus lockdown
body: Sri Lanka's opposition Wednesday called on the government to urgently recall parliament which was dissolved in March ahead of elections now postponed to June due to a coronavirus curfew.
